column4: Can I use Remote Desktop Viewer to connect to my Remote Desktop at work -- running MS Server Remote Desktop?
use terminal server client
hrmm...ok lemme try that
I'm getting and error, Name or Service Not Known
use the FQDN
for the protocol you mean?
in the client use the fqdn in the server field b/c ubuntu doesnt use netbios AFAIK
hrmm...shrug...I'm friggin' lost..er
i would install grdc, it is much better than the built in terminal server client anyway
Ok...I got to the server, but it seems I don't have terminal service rights, but I have remote rights....
that is a server side/AD issue, you have to be in the remote desktop users group
I am, cuz I can remote desktop in from a windows machine
what is FQDN ?
fully qualified domain name
for ex: tsserver1.eastco.department.company.com
ok
guess I'll have to speak with the IT guys in the morning, to add me to that group.
yea ask, and it might be that you're not allowed to access the terminal server from outside the company network
gotta be, but it's a weird setup, because I'm in the remote desktop group for use. I emailed them a screenshot of the error -- thanks for the help
hopefully they won't be jerks and say you're using ubuntu :/
nah...they know I run Ubuntu :)
